clustRviz 0.1.0

Save CBASS visualizations

saveviz.CBASS.Rd

This function will save dynamic CBASS visualizations as gifs and static visualizations as image files

# S3 method for CBASS
saveviz(x, file.name, plot.type = c("heatmap",
  "obs.dendrogram", "var.dendrogram"), image.type = c("dynamic",
  "static"), static.image.type = c("png"), dend.branch.width = 2,
  dend.labels.cex = 0.6, heatrow.label.cex = 1.5,
  heatcol.label.cex = 1.5, percent = NULL, k.obs = NULL,
  k.var = NULL, percent.seq = seq(from = 0.05, to = 1, by = 0.05),
  dynamic.width = 1200, dynamic.height = 700, static.width = 8,
  static.height = 5, ...)

Arguments

x

a CBASS object returned by CBASS
file.name

name and location of image to be saved.
plot.type

a string specifying the type of plot to produce. 'obs.dendrogram' and 'var.dendrogram' produces the CBASS cluster dendrogram for the observations and variables respecitvely. 'heatmap' produces a heatmap of the CBASS solution.
image.type

a string specifying the type of image output. 'dynamic' produced a gif of the plot.type along the CARP path. 'static' produces a single image of plot.type at a point along the CARP path.
static.image.type

string specifying the graphics device with which to save static images.
dend.branch.width

a positive number. Line width on dendrograms.
dend.labels.cex

a positive number. Label size on dendrograms.
heatrow.label.cex

heatmap row label size
heatcol.label.cex

heatmap column label size
percent

a number between 0 and 1. Specifies how far along the CARP path the static visualizations should display via the amount of regularization.
k.obs

An interger between 1 and n.obs. Specifies how far along the CARP path the static visualizations should display via the number of unique observation clusters.
k.var

An interger between 1 and p.var. Specifies how far along the CARP path the static visualizations should display via the number of unique variable clusters.
percent.seq

a vector of numbers between 0 and 1 specifying the positions along the CARP path used to generate dynamic images.
dynamic.width

dynamic output width in pixels
dynamic.height

dynamic output heigth in pixels
static.width

static output width in inches
static.height

static output height in inches
...

Unused additional generic arguements

Contents

  • Arguments
